title: Chinese Catholic-themed paintings from Xinxiang, Henan Province (1939-1941)
access: University of Notre Dame::Hesburgh Libraries::Rare Books and Special Collections
physicalAccess: University of Notre Dame::Hesburgh Libraries::Rare Books and Special Collections
description:
A digital exhibit of prints, made between 1939 and 1941 by Fu Jen Catholic University of Peking (CUP), from the original paintings that were commissioned by Rev. Thomas Megan,S.V.D., Prefect Apostolic of Xinxiang, Henan Province, and painted by Wang Suda,an artist trained at Fu Jen CUP. Wang's signature appears on twelve prints. 

 The prints were a gift of Grailville, a facility of the Grail in the US (Loveland, Ohio). 

 -------------------------------------- 

 Questions and comments should be directed to the curator of the collection:

 Juhn, Hye-jin 

 East Asian Studies Librarian 

 Hesburgh Libraries 

 p: 574-631-6121 

 e: hjuhn@nd.edu 

 Suggested Citation: 

 Juhn, Hye-jin. Chinese Catholic-themed Paintings from Xinxiang, Henan Province (1939-1941).  https://collections.library.nd.edu/xinxiang  Accessed on date.

--------------------------------------

items.title: 天堂永樂 : 主為愛伊者所備眼為曾見而未曾聞心未曾想的 (格林多二書二九) Tian tang yong le : zhu wei ai yi zhe suo bei yan wei ceng jian er wei ceng wen xin wei ceng xiang de (Gelinduo er shu er jiu) = Eternal Joy in Heaven :  The Lord has prepared for those who love him what eye has not seen, and ear has not heard, and what has not entered the human heart. (2 Corinthians 2 : 9)

items.title: 三位一體 : 作證在天原來有三父子聖神三歸於一 (若望一書五, 七) San wei yi ti : zuo zheng zai tian yuan lai you san fu zi sheng shen san gui yu yi (Ruowang yi shu wu, qi) = The Trinity : Jesus came to testify that the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit from the beginning were three in one. (1 John 5: 7)
